questions.question: When did Ranil Wickremesinghe assume office as the 9th President of Sri Lanka?
questions.answer: Ranil Wickremesinghe assumed office as the 9th President of Sri Lanka on 21 July 2022.

questions.question: Who preceded Ranil Wickremesinghe as President of Sri Lanka?
questions.answer: Gotabaya Rajapaksa preceded Ranil Wickremesinghe as President of Sri Lanka.

questions.question: How many times has Ranil Wickremesinghe served as Prime Minister of Sri Lanka?
questions.answer: Ranil Wickremesinghe has served as Prime Minister of Sri Lanka six times.

questions.question: Which political party has Ranil Wickremesinghe led since 1994?
questions.answer: Ranil Wickremesinghe has led the United National Party (UNP) since 1994.

questions.question: What ministerial roles does Ranil Wickremesinghe currently hold apart from being President?
questions.answer: Apart from being President, Ranil Wickremesinghe holds the roles of Minister of Finance, Minister of Defence, Minister of Technology, and Minister of Women, Child Affairs and Social Empowerment.

questions.question: Where did Ranil Wickremesinghe receive his early education?
questions.answer: Ranil Wickremesinghe received his early education at the Royal Preparatory School and the Royal College, Colombo.

questions.question: Which university did Ranil Wickremesinghe graduate from?
questions.answer: Ranil Wickremesinghe graduated from the University of Ceylon.

questions.question: What professional qualification did Ranil Wickremesinghe obtain after completing law exams?
questions.answer: Ranil Wickremesinghe qualified as an advocate after completing law exams at the Ceylon Law College in 1972.

questions.question: In which year did Ranil Wickremesinghe first become Prime Minister of Sri Lanka?
questions.answer: Ranil Wickremesinghe first became Prime Minister of Sri Lanka in 1993.

questions.question: What additional portfolios did Ranil Wickremesinghe hold during his tenure as Minister of Industry?
questions.answer: During his tenure as Minister of Industry, Ranil Wickremesinghe also held the additional portfolios of Science and Technology.

questions.question: What honorary doctorate did Ranil Wickremesinghe receive and from which university?
questions.answer: Ranil Wickremesinghe received an honorary doctorate from Deakin University in Australia on 14 February 2017.

questions.question: Which commission summoned Ranil Wickremesinghe regarding the Batalanda detention center allegations?
questions.answer: Ranil Wickremesinghe was summoned by a Special Presidential Commission of Inquiry regarding the Batalanda detention center allegations.

questions.question: What was one of the key findings of the Special Presidential Commission regarding Ranil Wickremesinghe's involvement in Batalanda?
questions.answer: One key finding of the Special Presidential Commission was that Ranil Wickremesinghe was indirectly responsible for the maintenance of places of unlawful detention and torture chambers at the Batalanda Housing Scheme.

questions.question: In which year did Ranil Wickremesinghe re-enter Parliament as a National List MP?
questions.answer: Ranil Wickremesinghe re-entered Parliament as a National List MP in 2021.

questions.question: Who did Ranil Wickremesinghe succeed as Prime Minister of Sri Lanka in May 2022?
questions.answer: Ranil Wickremesinghe succeeded Mahinda Rajapaksa as Prime Minister of Sri Lanka in May 2022.

questions.question: Why was Ranil Wickremesinghe sworn in as Prime Minister on 7 May 1993?
questions.answer: Ranil Wickremesinghe was sworn in as Prime Minister on 7 May 1993 after President Ranasinghe Premadasa was assassinated by the Tamil Tigers and Prime Minister D. B. Wijetunga was appointed as president.

questions.question: What was Wickremesinghe credited for during his first premiership?
questions.answer: During his first premiership, Wickremesinghe was credited for pushing Sri Lanka through an impressive economic transformation.

questions.question: Who defeated Wickremesinghe in the race for Opposition Leader in 1994?
questions.answer: Wickremesinghe was defeated in the race for Opposition Leader by fellow UNP member Gamini Dissanayake in 1994.

questions.question: Why did Ranil Wickremesinghe become the leader of the United National Party (UNP) and Opposition Leader in 1994?
questions.answer: Ranil Wickremesinghe became the leader of the United National Party (UNP) and Opposition Leader in 1994 after Gamini Dissanayake was assassinated by the Tamil Tigers, and his widow Srima lost the presidential election.

questions.question: How did the 1999 presidential election end for Wickremesinghe?
questions.answer: In the 1999 presidential election, Wickremesinghe lost to Chandrika Kumaratunga, who was re-elected with 51% of the popular vote.

questions.question: When did Ranil Wickremesinghe begin his second premiership?
questions.answer: Ranil Wickremesinghe began his second premiership on 9 December 2001 after leading the United National Front (UNF) to victory in the 2001 parliamentary election.

questions.question: What project did Wickremesinghe propose during his second premiership?
questions.answer: During his second premiership, Wickremesinghe proposed the 'Western Region Megapolis' project to build a large new city in Sri Lanka's western province.

questions.question: What was one of the outcomes of Wickremesinghe’s foreign policy during his second premiership?
questions.answer: One outcome of Wickremesinghe’s foreign policy was securing over 4.5 billion dollars in reconstruction and development aid during the Tokyo Donor Conference in 2003.

questions.question: What significant agreement did Ranil Wickremesinghe's government enter into in 2002?
questions.answer: Ranil Wickremesinghe's government entered into a ceasefire agreement (CFA) with the LTTE in February 2002 to halt all offensive military operations.

questions.question: Why did President Chandrika Kumaratunga dissolve Parliament in 2004, ending Wickremesinghe's second premiership?
questions.answer: President Chandrika Kumaratunga dissolved Parliament in 2004 and ended Wickremesinghe's second premiership, citing concerns about national security and using her constitutional powers to sack three ministers.

questions.question: What was the main objective of the ceasefire agreement signed by Ranil Wickremesinghe's government in 2002?
questions.answer: The main objective of the ceasefire agreement (CFA) signed in 2002 was to find a negotiated solution to the ongoing ethnic conflict in Sri Lanka.

questions.question: What was the significance of the Oslo Declaration during Wickremesinghe's peace talks with the LTTE?
questions.answer: The Oslo Declaration, made during peace talks in December 2003, was significant as it stated that both parties agreed to explore a political solution founded on internal self-determination within a united Sri Lanka.

questions.question: Why did the LTTE withdraw from the peace talks in 2003?
questions.answer: The LTTE abruptly withdrew from the peace talks in 2003 without providing clear reasons, although it later showed interest in re-entering negotiations by proposing the Interim Self Governing Authority (ISGA).

questions.question: What role did Norway play in the peace talks between Wickremesinghe's government and the LTTE?
questions.answer: Norway played the role of a facilitator and mediator during the peace talks between Wickremesinghe's government and the LTTE.

questions.question: How did Wickremesinghe's government respond to the ISGA proposal by the LTTE?
questions.answer: Wickremesinghe’s government showed willingness to discuss the ISGA proposal by the LTTE but was met with opposition from President Kumaratunga, who accused the government of being too soft on the Tigers.

questions.question: What is Siritunga Jayasuriya's current political position?
questions.answer: Siritunga Jayasuriya is the leader of the United Socialist Party.

questions.question: Which political parties was Siritunga Jayasuriya a member of before leading the United Socialist Party?
questions.answer: Siritunga Jayasuriya was formerly a member of the Lanka Sama Samaja Party and later the Nava Sama Samaja Party.

questions.question: What major economic reforms did Ranil Wickremesinghe propose?
questions.answer: Ranil Wickremesinghe proposed major economic reforms including a knowledge-based social market economy, focusing on social justice, global education opportunities, strengthening the health system, reducing income disparity, increasing exports, reforming state-owned enterprises, and developing tourism and the rural economy. He also planned to attract high spending tourists, develop special economic zones, and establish a financial and business hub in Colombo.

questions.question: What significant event took place at the Sri Lanka Economic Forum 2016?
questions.answer: The Sri Lanka Economic Forum 2016 featured international investor George Soros and Nobel Laureate Economist Joseph Stiglitz, and resulted in Soros deciding to invest approximately $300 million in Sri Lanka.

questions.question: What was the economic growth rate of Sri Lanka in 2017 during Wickremesinghe's tenure?
questions.answer: In 2017, Sri Lanka recorded an economic growth rate of just 3.1%, the lowest in 16 years.

questions.question: What action did Ranil Wickremesinghe take against corruption during the Rajapaksa regime?
questions.answer: Ranil Wickremesinghe set up the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID), which led to the arrest of Basil Rajapaksa and other political figures involved in large-scale corruption.

questions.question: What was the result of the 2018 local authority elections for the United National Party?
questions.answer: In the 2018 local authority elections, the United National Party led by Wickremesinghe suffered a landslide defeat, securing only 34 out of 340 councils, while the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna won 231 councils.

questions.question: What was the outcome of the constitutional crisis triggered by President Maithripala Sirisena in October 2018?
questions.answer: In October 2018, President Maithripala Sirisena appointed Mahinda Rajapaksa as prime minister, leading to a constitutional crisis. Ranil Wickremesinghe refused to accept the dismissal, claiming it was unconstitutional. After Supreme Court and Appeal Court rulings, Wickremesinghe was re-instated as prime minister on 16 December 2018.

questions.question: Who did Ranil Wickremesinghe support as the party candidate for the 2019 Sri Lankan presidential election?
questions.answer: Ranil Wickremesinghe supported Sajith Premadasa as the party candidate for the 2019 Sri Lankan presidential election, but Premadasa was defeated by Gotabaya Rajapaksa.

questions.question: What was the focus of Wickremesinghe's foreign policy during his third premiership?
questions.answer: Wickremesinghe's foreign policy aimed at re-balancing relations with India, the West, and China. He also worked on solving the Indo-Sri Lanka fishing dispute and developed relations with Japan and Singapore.

questions.question: What controversy arose from the government bond issuance in February 2015?
questions.answer: The February 2015 government bond issuance was controversial due to the oversubscription and acceptance of bids at higher rates than advertised, allegedly costing the government an additional Rs. 1.6 billion. The scandal involved Perpetual Treasuries Limited, owned by the son-in-law of the Central Bank Governor.

questions.question: What was the result of the 2020 Sri Lankan parliamentary elections for the United National Party?
questions.answer: In the 2020 parliamentary elections, the United National Party suffered its worst defeat in history, receiving only 2.15% of the votes and failing to win a single seat in parliament, except for one national list seat.

questions.question: What actions did Wickremesinghe take during the economic crisis following his appointment as prime minister in 2022?
questions.answer: During the economic crisis, Wickremesinghe introduced power and fuel rationing, increased direct taxes, and sought an IMF bailout. His administration faced criticism for continuing these policies and for the celebration of Sri Lanka's 75th independence anniversary amid the crisis.

questions.question: What was the Supreme Court's ruling on the 2023 local government elections?
questions.answer: The Supreme Court ruled that Wickremesinghe, along with other officials, violated fundamental rights by postponing the 2023 local government elections. Wickremesinghe acknowledged the ruling but stated he did not regret the decision, citing concerns for public safety.

questions.question: What was Ranil Wickremesinghe's political position and actions following the resignation of President Gotabaya Rajapaksa in July 2022?
questions.answer: Following President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's resignation in July 2022, Ranil Wickremesinghe was appointed acting president and later officially elected as the 9th President of Sri Lanka. He also faced protests and a significant crackdown on anti-government demonstrations.

questions.question: What was Ranil Wickremesinghe's announcement regarding the 2024 presidential election?
questions.answer: In August 2024, Ranil Wickremesinghe announced his intention to run for re-election in the upcoming presidential election as an independent candidate. He was endorsed by multiple parties and factions, marking his third bid for the presidency.

questions.question: Who is Ranil Wickremesinghe's spouse and what is known about his family?
questions.answer: Ranil Wickremesinghe is married to Maithree Wickremesinghe, a Sri Lankan academic. His paternal grandfather was Cyril Leonard Wickremesinghe, and his maternal grandfather was D. R. Wijewardena. Wickremesinghe's family has had several members active in government positions.

questions.question: What is Ranil Wickremesinghe's current political position?
questions.answer: Ranil Wickremesinghe is the President of Sri Lanka.

questions.question: Which political parties was Ranil Wickremesinghe a member of before becoming President?
questions.answer: Ranil Wickremesinghe was a member of the United National Party and has held various positions including Prime Minister.

questions.question: What are some of the honors received by Ranil Wickremesinghe?
questions.answer: Ranil Wickremesinghe was awarded the Robert E. Wilhelm Fellowship by the Massachusetts Institute of Technology in 2014 and an honorary Doctor of Laws degree from Deakin University in 2017.

questions.question: When did Ranil Wickremesinghe take office as the interim President of Sri Lanka?
questions.answer: Ranil Wickremesinghe was sworn in as the interim President of Sri Lanka on July 15, 2022.

questions.question: Which notable peace talks did Ranil Wickremesinghe participate in?
questions.answer: Ranil Wickremesinghe participated in several peace talks including those held in Bangkok, Oslo, Berlin, and Tokyo between 2002 and 2003.

questions.question: What was the impact of George Soros on Sri Lanka's foreign investment?
questions.answer: George Soros' presence was seen boosting more foreign investment in Sri Lanka.

questions.question: Who provided advice to boost the Sri Lankan economy along with Soros?
questions.answer: Joseph Stiglitz was to provide 'sound' advice to boost the Sri Lankan economy.

questions.question: What happened to Sri Lanka's economic growth in 2017?
questions.answer: Sri Lanka's economic growth in 2017 fell to a 16-year low.

questions.answer: Mahinda Rajapaksa was sworn in as the Prime Minister on 26 October 2018.

questions.answer: Wickremesinghe claimed his dismissal as Prime Minister was unconstitutional.
